msContents.summary: A paraphrased Persian translation and commentaries of Kitāb al-īmān, the first book of the Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim کتاب الایمان صحيح مسلم or al-Jāmiʿ al-Ṣaḥīḥ, the great collection of traditions by Muslim ibn al-Ḥajjāj al-Qushayrī, approximately 821-875 النسابورى، ابو الحسين مسلم بن الهجّاج القشيرى ،‏‏ . Hence the title Kitāb al-īmān attributed to the MS. by the copyist and subsequently lettered in Latin. The copyist remarks, in the colophon, that it contains the last part of the first section, and that it was composed in the year A.H. 666. He does not mention the name of the commentator. But he seems to have had in his disposal the commentator’s original handwritten copy, though it is in need of further scrutiny as the key word to this deduction, i.e. "handwritten" بخط is covered under repair and its accuracy cannot be ascertained. The commentator remains anonymous. An additional remark, though in a different hand f. 157v, suggests that it has been compared with the copy written by the commentator:قویل بید المولف بقدر الوسع و الامکان و الله المستعان It corresponds thoroughly with "bab al-iman" from the original Arabic Ṣahih of Muslim of which a complete copy is available at JRUL (128 [790], ff. 5b-28a). However, it is somewhat negligently copied and is variedly chapter-headed. Following the style of the paraphrased sections in the original Arabic, it begins without any of the usual amplificatory introductions and only two lines are confined to the mention of the God’s name and the preliminary prayer. Michael Kerney finds it odd and in his hand list of Persian MSS. in the JRUL suggests that "there may have been a separate preface or introduction prefixed." msItem.title: Kitāb al-īmān
کتاب الیمان
msItem.colophon: تمام شد کتاب الایمام که آخر جزء اول است بخط )؟( مولف رح و گفته در آخر او فرغت منه یوم الجمعه الثانی جمادی الاخر سنه ست و ستین وستمايه
msItem.incipit: f. 1r بسم الله الرحمن الرحیم الحمدلله رب العالمین و الصلوة و السلام علی سید الانبیاء و المرسلین و علی آله الطیبین و علی آله الطیبین و الطاهرین و اصحابه اجمعین کتاب الایمان ایمان در لغة بمعنی تصدیق مطلق است و در شرع تصدیق پیغمبر است صلی الله علیه و سلم بدانچه از نزد خدایتعالی آورده و به بندگان رسانیده
msItem.explicit: f. 157v حدثنا ابوبکر بن ابی شبیه حدثنا و کیع و حدثنا ابو حدثینا ابو معویه کلاهما عن العمش بهذالاسناد هر دو باسناد سابق غیر انهما قالا ورای آنکه هر دو گفته اند ما انتم بومیذ فی الناس الا کالشعره البیضا و فی الشور الاسود او کالشعر السودا فی الثور الابیض و لم یذکر اوالرقیمه فی ذراع الحمار و ذکر نکرده اوالرقیمه فی در الحمار را

provenance.p: Formerly part of the collection of the Persian scholar Nathaniel Bland (1803-1865). Bland’s oriental manuscripts were sold through Bernard Quaritch in 1866 to Alexander Lindsay, 25th Earl of Crawford.

acquisition.p: Purchased by Mrs Enriqueta Rylands, on behalf of the John Rylands Library, in 1901 from James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford.

source.p: Bibliographical description based on an index created by Reza Navabpour circa 1993. Identification of provenance based on manuscript catalogue by Michael Kerney, circa 1890s.

availability.p: The mansucript is available for consultation by any accredited reader, see Becoming a Reader for details. Please contact uml.special-collections@manchester.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript.
